main event: The report describes an unidentified flying object sighting near Bandar Abbas, Iran on February 10, 1952. The object was seen flying over the city and a few minutes later a severe explosion was heard that shook the buildings.
interesting points: The object was described as a strange shining object flying from east to west and then out to sea.
The sighting was reported by multiple sources including a newspaper, the chief of the Bandar Abbas telegraph office, and a newspaper correspondent who claimed to have seen the object.
Attempts to determine the size, shape, speed, and accurate direction of the object were unsuccessful.
The report states that the U.S. Air Force will continue to monitor the area and report any similar occurrences in the future.
The report is classified as downgraded at 3-year intervals and declassified after 12 years.
witnesses: multiple civilian sources including a newspaper, telegraph office chief, and newspaper correspondent
